alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Lincoln; Natrona; Park; Sublette; Teton; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 03 at 1:34AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Pacific System Brings Chance for Heavy Rain and Localized Flooding... A Pacific System brings above normal moisture values to Wyoming Sunday through Tuesday morning. Locations west of the Continental Divide, mainly over the higher terrain, are expected to get the highest rainfall totals through this period, with the chance of 1 to 2 inches. Locally higher values up to 3 inches are possible. The main threat of flooding will come with locally heavy rain from storms or from multiple rounds of rain in a row (training storms). Rain chances continue overnight both Sunday into Monday and Monday into Tuesday. The weather system travels eastward Monday, bringing the better moisture and higher rainfall totals across northern Wyoming, again favoring the higher terrain. The Bighorn Mountains, and nearby lower elevation locations could see 1 to 2 inches Monday through Tuesday morning. Again, locally heavy rain or training storms will be the main flooding concerns. Urban locations and places with poor drainage could quickly become water covered. Do not drive through flooded roadways and be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report any observed flooding to law enforcement.
